dialogs.line: Ah, a traveler! You’ve left the old town behind, haven’t you? A place like that rarely embraces those who dare to be different.
They’re wary of change, but don’t let that discourage you. Sometimes, what we leave behind isn’t worth chasing after.
Or perhaps you should return... as a hero! This fine armor will make you unstoppable, proof of your worth to them!
Unstoppable, but isolated. True acceptance doesn’t come from walls of steel. It comes from letting others see your true self.
Without protection, you’ll be vulnerable to harm, failure, rejection. This armor can shield you from it all. Isn’t that what you need?
And what good is protection if you can’t move forward? That armor might protect you, but it will slow you down, keeping you from reaching new places or people.

dialogs.question: So, traveler, what will it be? Will you take the armor and stand protected, or face the world bare, trusting in your openness to forge new bonds?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take the armor for the protection it offers.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll go without the armor and trust in others.

dialogs.line: A wise choice, friend. May this armor protect you well in the trials to come!
I only hope that your armor doesn’t keep others at a distance. True strength isn’t always found behind steel.
A bold decision. I hope your allies are as reliable as you believe. Without armor, you’ll move swiftly, but you’ll need to rely on others for support.
Thank you. I believe that through trust and connection, you will find the strength to face whatever awaits.
